How about in your country?
Today, we will be introducing how to make delicious edamame.
First, remove the stems from the edamame bean pods.
Add a generous amount of salt
and scrub the bean pods in a strainer.
This will remove the fuzz from the surface of the pods.
Rinse the edamame under running water
and strain.
Sprinkle on a little salt and toss to coat.
Then, place the edamame into a pan.
Distribute and avoid overlapping.
Cover and heat the pan on low heat.
Cook the edamame for about 3 minutes
until the water evaporates.
Sprinkle on some more water
and stir the edamame evenly.
Cover
and cook the edamame for 3 more minutes.
Repeat this procedure 3 to 4 times
until the edamame beans soften.
This cooking method will help
to retain the nutrients and savory taste
while keeping the edamame from getting mushy.
Now, it is ready.
Place the edamame onto a plate.
Edamame are young green soybeans
which are rich in proteins, vitamins, minerals
and omega-3 and -6 fatty acids.
It is also known to help break down the alcohol in your body
so it could be the best snack for your drinking party.
We recommend using a minimum amount of salt
to fully enjoy the taste of the edamame.
Good luck in the kitchen!
